definition: popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate

sentences.english: Besides, the McCain dictum is debatable.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，麥凱恩的順口溜也值得商榷。

sentences.english: This is the jingle that people writes to me.
sentences.chinese: 這是人們給我編的順口溜。
這是一個小男孩的順口溜。

sentences.english: " Reporting the dish names" is an excellent Guankou piece of traditional cross talk.
sentences.chinese: 《報菜名》是傳統相聲中一段很精彩的順口溜。

sentences.english: Jingle Ma is still young at heart.
sentences.chinese: 順口溜馬是還年輕的心。

definition: humorous poem/limerick
saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
slang
common saying/proverb/colloquial speech
nursery rhyme
(slang) swearword/four-letter word
Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
pun/play on words
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
synonym
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
large wicker basket
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
